The first known published reference to "doughnut" was in Washington Irving's 1809 book A History of New York, from the Beginning of the World to the End of the Dutch Dynasty. Irving described "balls of sweetened dough, fried in hog's fat, and called doughnuts, or olykoeks." These "nuts" of fried dough might now be called doughnut holes.

A Krispy Kreme doughnut is a doughnut (a type of sweet fried dough) made by the Krispy Kreme company.
